attributes.action: local council and police to take more action against the rising acid attacks.
attributes.background:
local council and police to take more action against the rising acid attacks.

There has been a number of these incidents in recent months and such attacks are more terrifying that knive and gun attacks. More needs to be done to ban such substances and more severe punishment for criminals.

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about acid attacks, but we aren't sure what specific action you would like the UK Government or Parliament to take. 

If you want your local council to take action, you could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

If you want your local police to take action, you could raise your issue with your local Police and Crime Commissioner (PCC). You can use this page to find out who your PCC is:
 
http://www.apccs.police.uk/find-your-pcc/
